text: The Type 160 was an early large automobile manufactured by the French company Automobiles Peugeot in 1923. It was constructed by French private coachbuilder Jean-Henri Labourdette to be styled like a small boat, a trait from which it was also called the Skiff. In 2011, the Type 160 was exhibited by Bonhams in a collection entitled "110 years of the automobile" at the Grand Palais and later auctioned. == See also == * Peugeot * List of Peugeot vehicles == References == Category:Peugeot vehicles Category:Cars introduced in 1923 Category:1920s cars
title: Peugeot Type 160
